p: Comparing Eqs. 11 and 2c shows that the first Nash sub-optimality of not taking positive externalities of abatement in one country to the rest of the world into account is now removed, but the second sub-optimality of differentiated, country-specific, marginal cost of abatement is still present due to the absence of a global permit market. This sub-optimality can be removed by empowering S to install a global permit market.
